name: chicken tagine
ingredients: 1 large free-range chicken cut into pieces (or thighs)
150 g of green or pink pitted olives
About 20 cl of water or chicken broth
steps: Chop the cilantro, parsley, and the skin of the preserved lemon. In a bowl, add the chicken with a drizzle of olive oil, ras el hanout, turmeric, the chopped herbs, the preserved lemon, and pepper. Let marinate (at least 10 minutes).
In a pot or saut√© pan, heat the olive oil and butter. Brown the chicken pieces on all sides. Remove them.
Replace with the chopped onions and garlic. Add the crushed saffron and ras el hanout. Let the onions soften for 10 minutes.
Add the chicken pieces, pour in the broth or water (up to half the height), and add some freshly grated ginger. Cover and let simmer for 45 minutes.
Add the olives and the preserved lemon cut into cubes. Continue cooking for 30 minutes covered. If the sauce is too liquid, thicken it with a bit of diluted cornstarch. Serve hot.
